metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14776 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A heap-based buffer over-read exists in DemuxInit() in demux/asf/asf.c in VideoLAN VLC media player 3.0.7.1 via a crafted .mkv file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14776` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc-bin - 3.0.8-2
libvlc5 - 3.0.8-2
libvlccore9 - 3.0.8-2
vlc - 3.0.8-2
vlc-bin - 3.0.8-2
vlc-data - 3.0.8-2
vlc-l10n - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-access-extra - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-base - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-jack - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-notify - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-qt - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-samba - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-skins2 - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-svg - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-video-output - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-video-splitter - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-visualization - 3.0.8-2
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Antonio Morales from the Semmle Security Team

criterions.comment: vlc package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.8-2').
